news_insight_text_link.news_insight_description: AquaBattery, a climate tech startup based in Alphen aan den Rijn, the Netherlands, specializing in saltwater long duration energy storage solutions, has successfully raised €6M in seed funding.

identifier.value: Jiajun Cen Founder and CEO @ AquaBattery

properties.growth_insight_description: AquaBattery may be growing as it has developed a Long Duration Energy Storage (LDES) technology that utilizes table salt and water, indicating innovation and advancement in its product offerings. The company is mentioned in a roundup of LDES news, suggesting it is active and recognized in the energy storage industry. Furthermore, AquaBattery is described as offering a safe and sustainable alternative to traditional batteries, which could imply a competitive edge in the market for environmentally conscious consumers.

about_short_description.short_description: AquaBattery develops batteries that store electricity using renewable energy technologies for various clients.

product.name: Novel Flow Battery
product.description: A flow battery technology that stores electricity in acid, base, and saltwater solutions, suitable for long-duration applications and utility-scale deployment.

product.name: Long Duration Energy Storage (LDES)
product.description: Enables the storage of excess renewable energy for prolonged periods, making renewable sources like solar and wind reliable and dispatchable.

product.name: Commercial & Industrial Users
product.description: Provides energy storage solutions for companies to optimize renewable asset value, reduce energy costs, and achieve net-zero targets.

product.name: Remote Microgrids
product.description: Offers a sustainable and affordable energy storage solution for remote areas, replacing diesel generators with renewable energy-coupled systems.

product.name: Renewable Power Producers
product.description: Stores excess renewable power to balance the grid, ensuring a reliable supply of renewable power at all times.
